title: Coordinate Plane and Graphing Relationships

vocab.definition: A flat surface formed by two perpendicular number lines
One of the four sections of the coordinate plane
The point (0, 0) where the x-axis and y-axis intersect
A pair of numbers (x, y) that locates a point on the coordinate plane
A relationship between two variables that forms a straight line when graphed

teachingNotes: Practice plotting points in all four quadrants. Introduce simple linear relationships and patterns. Use real-world data for graphing activities.

sample.question: What do we call the point (0, 0) on the coordinate plane?

truefalse.question: The coordinate plane has four quadrants.

multiplechoice.question: In which quadrant is the point (-3, 2)?

fillintheblank.question: A relationship that forms a straight line when graphed is called a ________ relationship.

shortanswer.question: What are the signs of x and y coordinates in Quadrant III?

wordProblems.question: A point moves from (2, 3) to (5, 3). How many units did it move and in which direction?
